result.execSummary:
On one or more charges in this case, Daniel A Ostrowski was found not guilty by reason of mental disease or defect. The defendant was found guilty of actually committing the crime(s) charged, but was also found not to be legally responsible under Wis. Stats. 971.165 for committing the crime(s) because of the defendant's mental condition. The legal effect of a finding of not guilty by reason of mental disease or defect is that the court must commit the defendant to the custody of the Department of Health and Family Services.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Conditional Release Plan

Defendant Daniel A Ostrowski in court with attorney Travis Stephen Slattery.  Nicholas Grode appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Parties have received the Conditional Release Plan and have no objections to the plan.  

Court has reviewed the Conditional Release Treatment Plan and finds that it is appropriate.  Court orders all conditions as stated in the Plan.

for Examination under 971.16
fax cover sheet
for Modification of Bond

Defendant Daniel A Ostrowski in court with attorney Travis Stephen Slattery.  Nicholas Grode appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Joe Zurfluh is sworn and questioned by Attorney Grode. Testifies to being on duty and being dispatched to the Town of Rudolph regarding a disturbance at a home.  Testifies that defendant did not have consent to remove car keys and take a vehicle from the home.   Witness identifies the defendant in the courtroom.  Witness testifies that defendant fled from him when he attempted to stop his vehicle.

Attorney Slattery makes a motion that witness did not properly identify the defendant.  Deputy Joe Zurfluh is recalled to the witness stand and identifies the defendant in the courtroom as the driver of vehicle.  Cross-examination by Attorney Slattery.  

Court finds probable cause to believe that a felony was committed and that the defendant committed it.  Bond is continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for December 19, 2014 at 11:00 am.  

Defendant enters an NGI plea. Attorney Slattery will draft the Order.
Preliminary hearing and Arraignment on November 7, 2014 at 03:15 pm.

Defendant Daniel A Ostrowski in court with attorney Emily M. Nolan-Plutchak.  Craig Lambert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Parties stipulate to the report of Dr. Galle.  Court questions the defendant who understands the contents of the report and agrees that he is competent to proceed.  Matter will be set for a preliminary hearing. Bond will continue.
